titlePart.text: SECTION E FIXED CONSTRUCTIONS
BUILDING
BUILDING
titlePart.entryReference: layered materials, layered products in general

titlePart.text: GENERAL BUILDING CONSTRUCTIONS
WALLS
ROOFS
FLOORS
CEILINGS
INSULATION OR OTHER PROTECTION OF BUILDINGS
titlePart.entryReference: border constructions of openings for doors, windows, or the like

titlePart.text: Constructions in general
Structures which are not restricted either to walls or floors or ceilings or roofs

the particular parts of buildings, see the relevant groups for those parts

titlePart.text: Structures consisting primarily of load-supporting, block-shaped or slab-shaped elements

the elements being prestressed
the elements consisting of metal

the elements consisting of other material
the elements being composed of two or more materials

Structures made from masses, e.g. concrete, cast or similarly formed in situ with or without making use of additional elements, such as permanent forms, sub-structures to be coated with load-bearing material

titlePart.entryReference: elongated load-supporting parts as elements, trusses, truss-like structures

titlePart.text: Structures covering a large free area, whether open-sided or not, e.g. hangars, halls
titlePart.entryReference: non-structural features for specified purposes, see the relevant groups of

titlePart.text: Structures characterised by movable, separable, or collapsible parts, e.g. for transport

titlePart.text: Structures composed of units comprising at least considerable parts of two sides of a room, e.g. box-like or cell-like units closed or in skeleton form

titlePart.entryReference: conveying or assembling of building materials

titlePart.text: Connecting devices designed for being embedded in concrete or masonry

with self-penetrating parts, e.g. claw dowels

titlePart.text: built-up from layers of building elements
Walls having neither cavities between, nor in, the solid elements
using elements having specially-designed means for stabilising the position
by interlocking of projections or inserts with indentations, e.g. of tongues, grooves, dovetails
by filling material with or without reinforcements in small channels in, or in grooves between, the elements
using elements having a general shape differing from that of a parallelepiped
Walls having cavities in, but not between, the elements, i. e. each cavity being enclosed by at least four sides forming part of one single element
using elements having specially designed means for stabilising the position
by interlocking of projections or inserts with indentations, e.g. of tongues, grooves, dovetails
by filling material with or without reinforcements in small channels in, or in grooves between, the elements
using elements having a general shape differing from that of a parallelepiped

the walls being characterised by fillings in all cavities in order to form a wall construction
Walls having cavities between, but not in, the elements

using elements having specially designed means for stabilising the position

by interlocking of projections or inserts with indentations, e.g. of tongues, grooves, dovetails
by filling material with or without reinforcements in small channels in, or in grooves between, the elements
using elements having a general shape differing from that of a parallelepiped
the walls being characterised by fillings in some of the cavities forming load-bearing pillars or beams
the walls being characterised by fillings in all cavities in order to form a wall construction
Walls having cavities between, as well as in, the elements
Walls of elements each consisting of two or more parts, kept in distance by means of spacers, at least one of the parts having cavities
using elements having specially designed means for stabilising the position

by interlocking of projections or inserts with indentations, e.g. of tongues, grooves, dovetails
by filling material with or without reinforcements in small channels in, or in grooves between, the elements
using elements having a general shape differing from that of a parallelepiped

the prefabricated parts of the beams consisting wholly of metal

noteParagraph.text: The term "ceiling" includes all the finishing material concealing the underside of the load-carrying ceiling structure or roof structure.
